questions.correctAnswer: It refers to the current object

options: It checks if a variable is defined
It returns the type of a variable or expression
It converts a value to a specific type
It checks if a variable is null
questions.correctAnswer: It returns the type of a variable or expression

questions.question: What is the JavaScript 'event loop'?
options: A loop used to iterate over arrays
A loop used for asynchronous code execution
A loop used to handle errors
A loop used for network requests
questions.correctAnswer: A loop used for asynchronous code execution

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Promise' object in JavaScript?
options: To represent a value that might be available now or in the future
questions.correctAnswer: To represent a value that might be available now or in the future

A function that returns a callback
A function that takes no arguments
questions.correctAnswer: A function that is called after an asynchronous operation is completed

questions.correctAnswer: To create a new array with the results of calling a provided function on every element in the array
